main event: An object was observed in the sky 35 minutes after sunset, initially moving south to north, then changing direction and fading above the horizon.
interesting points: The object was circular and bright white with alternating brightness as it passed overhead., It reached a maximum altitude of 80 degrees to the South before fading away., Observations were made using binoculars., The sighting lasted a total of 10 minutes., It was concluded to be a satellite.
witness description: Officers on the deck including the junior officer of the deck, executive officer, and quartermaster of watch.
